thread.title: China IT company moving into California
thread.title_full: China IT company moving into California

author: news.com.au
title: China IT company moving into California
text:
A CHINESE server maker and software developer will set up manufacturing plants and research centres in California, state media reports.
EASTERN China-based IT company Inspur will establish a fully controlled subsidiary in the British Virgin Islands and another in the United States, with each investment not exceeding $US10 million ($A13.60 million), according to a filing with the Shenzhen Stock Exchange on Saturday, the Xinhua news agency reported.
Headquartered in the city of Jinan, Shandong province, Inspur is expected to tap the international and especially the American market, Xinhua said. Chinese banks and e-commerce companies were mulling replacing their high-end IBM servers with Inspur's Tiansuo K1 server, the Chinese financial magazine Caixin reported in July last year. The Chinese government was reviewing whether domestic banks' reliance on high-end IBM servers compromised the nation's financial security, the article said.
